00040 using namespace affx;

00042 /**
00043  * This is the engine that takes data and transforms it into clustering spaces
00044  *
00045  * @param aVal - a allele probe summary
00046  * @param bVal - b allele probe summary
00047  * @param trans - transformation of data
00048  * @param K - stretching parameter
00049  * @param xVal - output difference of a vs b, transformed
00050  * @param yVal - output total amount of stuff, transformed
00051  */
00052 void valueForTransformation(double aVal, double bVal, enum Transformation trans,
00053                                          double K, double &xVal, double &yVal) {
00054   double c = 0.001;
00055   double denom = 0;
00056   switch (trans) {
00057   case MvA: // Minus vs Average
00058     if(aVal == 0) aVal = c;
00059     if(bVal == 0) bVal = c;
00060         //note: reversed to be consistent
00061         // xVal always contains comparison between alleles
00062     yVal = (log2(bVal) + log2(aVal)) / 2;
00063     xVal = log2(aVal) - log2(bVal);
00064     break;
00065   case RvT: // R vs Theta (polar)
00066     // Check to make sure we're not got to take log of 0
00067     denom = bVal;
00068     if(bVal == 0) bVal = c;
00069         // center "Theta" at zero
00070     xVal = atan(aVal/ denom)-0.7853982;
00071     yVal = log( sqrt((aVal * aVal) + (bVal * bVal) + c) );
00072     break;
00073   case  CES:
00074     ContrastExtremesStretch(K, aVal, bVal, xVal, yVal);
00075     break;
00076   case CCS:
00077     ContrastCentersStretch(K, aVal, bVal, xVal, yVal);
00078     break;
00079   default:
00080     Err::errAbort("GenoUtility: valueforTransformation Don't recognize transformation type: " + ToStr(trans));
00081   }
00082 }
00083 
00084 /**
00085  * Convert a (text insensitive) text repesentation of a transformation into
00086  * the enumration.
00087  * @param s - string specifying transformation.
00088  * @return - Enumeration version of transformation.
00089  */
00090 enum Transformation transformationForString(const std::string& str) {
00091   std::string lowerS = Util::downcaseString(str);
00092 
00093   if(lowerS == "mva")
00094     return MvA;
00095   else if(lowerS == "rvt")
00096     return RvT;
00097   else if(lowerS == "ssf" || lowerS == "ces")
00098     return CES;
00099   else if(lowerS == "assf" || lowerS == "ccs")
00100     return CCS;
00101   else
00102     Err::errAbort("GenoUtility::transformationForString() - Don't recognize transformation: " + str);
00103   return MvA;
00104 }
00105 
00106 /**
00107  * Convert a transformation enum to string representation
00108  * @param t - tranformation enum value.
00109  * @return - text description of enumeration.
00110  */
00111 std::string stringForTransformation(enum Transformation t) {
00112   switch(t) {
00113   case MvA :
00114     return "MvA";
00115     break;
00116   case RvT :
00117     return "RvT";
00118     break;
00119   case CES :
00120     return "CES";
00121     break;
00122   case CCS:
00123     return "CCS";
00124     break;
00125   default:
00126     Err::errAbort("GenoUtility::stringForTransformation() - Don't recognize type: " + ToStr(t));
00127   }
00128   Err::errAbort("GenoUtility::stringForTransformation() - Should never reach this point.");
00129   return "";
00130 }
00131 
00132 /**
00133  * Return the calumn names for the values generated by a given transformation
00134  * @param t - tranformation enum value.
00135  * @return - a pair of column names
00136  */
00137 std::pair<std::string,std::string> columnNamesForTransformation(enum Transformation t) {
00138   switch(t) {
00139   case MvA :
00140     return std::pair<std::string,std::string>("Log Ratio","Strength");
00141     break;
00142   case RvT :
00143     return std::pair<std::string,std::string>("R","Theta");
00144     break;
00145   case CES :
00146     return std::pair<std::string,std::string>("Contrast","Strength");
00147     break;
00148   case CCS:
00149     return std::pair<std::string,std::string>("Contrast","Strength");
00150     break;
00151   default:
00152     Err::errAbort("GenoUtility::columnNamesForTransformation() - Don't recognize type: " + ToStr(t));
00153   }
00154   Err::errAbort("GenoUtility::columnNamesForTransformation() - Should never reach this point.");
00155   return std::pair<std::string,std::string>("","");
00156 }

00158 /** transform the data vector */
00159 void GenoUtility_transformData(std::vector<double> &aVals,
00160                                std::vector<double> &bVals,
00161                                Transformation m_Transform,
00162                                double m_K)
00163 {
00164     assert(aVals.size() == bVals.size());
00165     double x = 0, y = 0;
00166     for(unsigned int i = 0; i < aVals.size(); i++) {
00167       valueForTransformation(aVals[i], bVals[i], m_Transform, m_K, x, y);
00168       aVals[i] = x;
00169       bVals[i] = y;
00170     }
00171   }
00172 
00173 /**
00174  * Contrast Centers Stretch. In 2007 this is the current favorite for
00175  * algorithms, scales values between -1 and 1.
00176  * \f$ X = asinh(K * (A-B)/(A+B)) / asinh(K) \f$ <br>
00177  * \f$ Y = log_2(A + B) \f$ <br>
00178  *
00179  * @param K -
00180  * @param a - Value (usually summarized intensity) from A allele.
00181  * @param b - Value (usually summarized intensity) from B allele.
00182  * @param x -
00183  * @param y -
00184  */
00185 void ContrastCentersStretch(double K, double a, double b, double &x, double &y) {
00186   double denom = 0;
00187   double r = 0.0;
00188   denom = b + a;
00189   if(denom == 0) {
00190     Err::errAbort("GenoUtility::ContrastCentersStretch() - Can't have zero sum signal.");
00191   }
00192   r = K * (a - b)/denom;
00193   r = log(r + sqrt(r*r+1));
00194   x = r / log(K + sqrt(K*K+1));
00195   y = log2(denom);
00196 }
00197 
00198 /**
00199  * Contrast Extremes Stretch.
00200  * \f$ X = sinh(K * (A-B)/(A+B)) / sinh(K) \f$ <br>
00201  * \f$ Y = log_2(A + B) \f$ <br>
00202  *
00203  * @param K -
00204  * @param a - Value (usually summarized intensity) from A allele.
00205  * @param b - Value (usually summarized intensity) from B allele.
00206  * @param x -
00207  * @param y -
00208  */
00209 void ContrastExtremesStretch(double K, double a, double b, double &x, double &y) {
00210   double denom = 0;
00211   denom = b + a;
00212   if(denom == 0) {
00213     Err::errAbort("GenoUtility::ContrastExtremesStretch() - Can't have zero sum signal.");
00214   }
00215   x = sinh( K * (a - b)/denom) / sinh(K);
00216   y = log2(denom);
00217 }
00218 
00219 /**
00220  * Calculate the median PM values for the A and B alleles given data
00221  * in cel file.
00222  *
00223  * @param cel - Cel file of data.
00224  * @param ps - ProbeSet for determining A and B alleles.
00225  * @param Amedian - Filled in with median PM A value.
00226  * @param Bmedian - Filled in with median PM B value.
00227  *
00228  * @return
00229  */
00230 bool alleleMedians(affymetrix_fusion_io::FusionCELData *cel, const ProbeSet *ps,
00231                                       float &Amedian, float &Bmedian) {
00232   vector<float> AValues, BValues;
00233   /* Genotype probe sets can have either 2 or 4 groups, for each
00234      type the even (0,2) are A alleles and odd (1,3) are B allele.s */
00235   if(ps->numGroups != 2 && ps->numGroups != 4) {
00236     return false;
00237   }
00238 
00239   if (ps->psType != ProbeSet::GenoType)
00240       return false;
00241 
00242   int groupOffset = 0; // atoms are stored in blocks for each allele, keep track of which block we're in.
00243   for(unsigned int groupIx = 0; groupIx < ps->numGroups; groupIx++) {
00244         /* Probe belongs to the A allele, put atoms in that probeset. */
00245         if(groupIx == ProbeSet::Aforward || groupIx == ProbeSet::Areverse) {
00246           for(unsigned int atomIx = groupOffset; atomIx < ps->atomsPerGroup[groupIx] + groupOffset; atomIx++) {
00247         Atom *A = ps->atoms[atomIx];
00248         for(int probeIx = 0; probeIx < A->probes.size(); probeIx++) {
00249             Probe *p = A->probes[probeIx];
00250             if(Probe::isPm(*p)) {
00251                 float intensity = cel->GetIntensity(p->id);
00252                 AValues.push_back(intensity);
00253             }
00254         }
00255           }
00256         }
00257         /* Probe belongs to the B allele, put atoms in that probeset. */
00258         else if(groupIx == ProbeSet::Bforward || groupIx == ProbeSet::Breverse) {
00259           for(unsigned int atomIx = groupOffset; atomIx < ps->atomsPerGroup[groupIx] + groupOffset; atomIx++) {
00260         Atom *A = ps->atoms[atomIx];
00261         for(int probeIx = 0; probeIx < A->probes.size(); probeIx++) {
00262             Probe *p = A->probes[probeIx];
00263             if(Probe::isPm(*p)) {
00264                 float intensity = cel->GetIntensity(p->id);
00265                 BValues.push_back(intensity);
00266             }
00267         }
00268           }
00269         }
00270         /* Uh-oh, if it doesn't belong to A and it doesn't belong to B we're going to complain. */
00271         else {
00272           return false;
00273         }
00274         groupOffset += ps->atomsPerGroup[groupIx];
00275   }
00276 
00277   if(AValues.empty() || BValues.empty())
00278       return false;
00279 
00280   Amedian = median_in_place(AValues.begin(), AValues.end());
00281   Bmedian = median_in_place(BValues.begin(), BValues.end());
00282   return true;
00283 }

00285 /* mimic Eric's code */
00286 bool probesetMean(affymetrix_fusion_io::FusionCELData *cel, const ProbeSet *ps, 
00287                   float &mean) {
00288   vector<float> Values;
00289   /* Genotype probe sets can have either 2 or 4 groups, for each
00290      type the even (0,2) are A alleles and odd (1,3) are B allele.s */
00291   //if(ps->numGroups != 2 && ps->numGroups != 4) {
00292   //  return false;
00293   //}
00294   
00295   //Verbose::out(4, "there are "+ ToStr(ps->numGroups) + " groups");
00296   Err::check(ps->numGroups == 1, 
00297              "alleleMinMax() - Thought for Falcon, there should just be 1 group.");
00298   int atomsPer = ps->atoms.size();
00299   //Verbose::out(4, "atoms per group is "+ ToStr(atomsPer));
00300   /* Each block will have atomsPer atoms in there. */
00301   for(int atomIx = 0; atomIx < atomsPer; atomIx++) {
00302     Atom *A = ps->atoms[atomIx];
00303     for(int probeIx = 0; probeIx < A->probes.size(); probeIx++) {
00304       Probe *p = A->probes[probeIx];
00305       if(Probe::isPm(*p)) {
00306         float intensity = cel->GetIntensity(p->id);
00307         Values.push_back(intensity);
00308       }
00309     }
00310     
00311   }
00312   
00313   if(Values.empty()) 
00314     Err::errAbort("alleleMinMax() - Empty value vectors in probeset: " + ToStr(ps->name));
00315    mean = average(Values.begin(), Values.end());
00316   
00317   return true;
00318 }

00321 bool probesetStd(affymetrix_fusion_io::FusionCELData *cel, const ProbeSet *ps, 
00322                   float &std) {
00323   vector<float> Values;
00324   /* Genotype probe sets can have either 2 or 4 groups, for each
00325      type the even (0,2) are A alleles and odd (1,3) are B allele.s */
00326   //if(ps->numGroups != 2 && ps->numGroups != 4) {
00327   //  return false;
00328   //}
00329   
00330   //Verbose::out(4, "there are "+ ToStr(ps->numGroups) + " groups");
00331   Err::check(ps->numGroups == 1, 
00332              "alleleMinMax() - Thought for Falcon, there should just be 1 group.");
00333   int atomsPer = ps->atoms.size();
00334   for(int atomIx = 0; atomIx < atomsPer; atomIx++) {
00335     Atom *A = ps->atoms[atomIx];
00336     for(int probeIx = 0; probeIx < A->probes.size(); probeIx++) {
00337       Probe *p = A->probes[probeIx];
00338       if(Probe::isPm(*p)) {
00339         float intensity = cel->GetIntensity(p->id);
00340         Values.push_back(intensity);
00341       }
00342     }
00343     
00344   }
00345   
00346   if(Values.empty()) 
00347     Err::errAbort("alleleMinMax() - Empty value vectors in probeset: " + ToStr(ps->name));
00348    std = unbiased_stddev(Values.begin(), Values.end());
00349   return true;
00350 }

00353 bool probesetMeanStd(affymetrix_fusion_io::FusionCELData *cel, const ProbeSet *ps, 
00354                      float &mean, float &std) {
00355   vector<float> Values;
00356   /* Genotype probe sets can have either 2 or 4 groups, for each
00357      type the even (0,2) are A alleles and odd (1,3) are B allele.s */
00358   //if(ps->numGroups != 2 && ps->numGroups != 4) {
00359   //  return false;
00360   //}
00361   
00362   //Verbose::out(4, "there are "+ ToStr(ps->numGroups) + " groups");
00363   Err::check(ps->numGroups == 1, 
00364              "alleleMinMax() - Thought for Falcon, there should just be 1 group.");
00365   int atomsPer = ps->atoms.size();
00366   for(int atomIx = 0; atomIx < atomsPer; atomIx++) {
00367     Atom *A = ps->atoms[atomIx];
00368     for(int probeIx = 0; probeIx < A->probes.size(); probeIx++) {
00369       Probe *p = A->probes[probeIx];
00370       if(Probe::isPm(*p)) {
00371         float intensity = cel->GetIntensity(p->id);
00372         Values.push_back(intensity);
00373       }
00374     }
00375     
00376   }
00377   
00378   if(Values.empty()) 
00379     Err::errAbort("alleleMinMax() - Empty value vectors in probeset: " + ToStr(ps->name));
00380   std = unbiased_stddev(Values.begin(), Values.end());
00381   mean = average(Values.begin(), Values.end());
00382   return true;
00383 }

00388 /**
00389  * Calculate the natural log ratio for two probeset signal
00390  *
00391  *@para signalA -- e.x. signal channel 
00392  *@para signalB -- e.x. background channel
00393  *
00394  */
00395 double logRatio(double sigA, double sigB){
00396   sigB = sigB <=0? 1 : sigB;
00397   return(log(sigA/sigB));
00398 }

00401 /** 
00402  * Open and read a target distribution from a text file. Must have a column
00403  * called 'intensities' with distribution quantiles sorted from highest to 
00404  * lowest.
00405  * 
00406  * @param fileName - text file containing column of quantiles.
00407  * @para sketch - vector that stores the sketch.
00408  */
00409 
00410 void  loadTargetSketchFromFile(const char *fileName, std::vector<float> &sketch) {
00411   TsvFile tsv;
00412   double intensity;
00413   // file ok
00414   int rc = tsv.open(fileName);
00415   assert(rc==TSV_OK);
00416   //
00417   tsv.bind(0,"intensities",&intensity);
00418   assert(tsv.cname2cidx(0,"intensities")>=0);
00419 
00420   sketch.clear();
00421   while (tsv.nextLevel(0)==TSV_OK) {
00422     sketch.push_back(intensity);
00423   }
00424   tsv.close();
00425 }
00426 
00427 
00428 /** 
00429  * Read in the precomputed genotypes from a tab delimited file. Must
00430  * be a column for each Celfile with same header name as celfile and an row
00431  * for every snp to be analyzed. There can be extra columns and order of columns
00432  * is not important as the resulting order will be the same as the colNames
00433  * vector. Steal from GenoSeedTxt. 
00434  * @param fileName - text file containing the known genotype calls
00435  * @para colNames - the name of samples. 
00436  * @para knownCalls -- the map that store knownCalls infomation for each SNP.
00437  */
00438 void loadSNPHints(std::string fileName, 
00439                   std::vector<std::string> &colNames,
00440                   std::map<std::string,std::vector<affx::GType> > &knownCalls) {
00441   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00442   vector<GType> calls(colNames.size());
00443   vector<int> intCalls(colNames.size());
00444   vector<uint32_t> hetChrxCalls(colNames.size(), 0);
00445   vector<uint32_t> hetChrxPossibleCalls(colNames.size(), 0);
00446   vector<uint32_t> madeCalls(colNames.size(), 0);
00447   vector<uint32_t> possibleCalls(colNames.size(), 0);
00448   
00449   string probeset;
00450 
00451   /* Expecting one column for the id and one for each cel file. */
00452   tsv.bind(0,"probeset_id", &probeset, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00453   for(uint32_t i = 0; i < colNames.size(); i++) {
00454     string s = Fs::basename(colNames[i]);
00455     tsv.bind(0, s.c_str(), &intCalls[i], TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00456   }
00457 
00458   Verbose::out(1, "Reading in hints genotypes from " + ToStr(fileName));
00459 
00460   if(tsv.open(fileName) != TSV_OK) {
00461     Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file: " + ToStr(fileName) + " to read.");
00462   }
00463 
00464   knownCalls.clear();
00465 
00466   while(tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK) {
00467     if(knownCalls.find(probeset) != knownCalls.end()) {
00468       Err::errAbort("Found probeset: " + probeset + " specified multiple times in file: " + ToStr(fileName));
00469     }
00470     
00471     /* convert to char as tsv doesn't bind char. */
00472     for(uint32_t i = 0; i < intCalls.size(); i++) {
00473       // this converts -1 to NN, 0 to AA, 1 to AB, 2 to BB
00474       calls[i] = GType_from_int(intCalls[i]);
00475     }
00476     knownCalls[probeset] = calls; // contain no calls for a SNP.
00477   }
00478   tsv.close();
00479 }

00482 bool probesetMinMax(affymetrix_fusion_io::FusionCELData *cel, const ProbeSet *ps, 
00483                   float &Min, float &Max) {
00484   Min = -1;
00485   Max = -1;
00486   vector<float> Values;
00487   /* Genotype probe sets can have either 2 or 4 groups, for each
00488      type the even (0,2) are A alleles and odd (1,3) are B allele.s */
00489   //if(ps->numGroups != 2 && ps->numGroups != 4) {
00490   //  return false;
00491   //}
00492   
00493   //Verbose::out(4, "there are "+ ToStr(ps->numGroups) + " groups");
00494   Err::check(ps->numGroups == 1, 
00495              "alleleMinMax() - Thought for Falcon, there should just be 1 group.");
00496   //for(int psIx = 0; psIx < ps->numGroups - 1; psIx ++) {
00497     //Err::check(ps->atomsPerGroup[psIx] == ps->atomsPerGroup[psIx+1], 
00498     //"alleleMinMax() - Thought groups were symmetrical.");
00499   int atomsPer = ps->atoms.size();
00500   //Verbose::out(4, "atoms per group is "+ ToStr(atomsPer));
00501   /* Each block will have atomsPer atoms in there. */
00502   for(int atomIx = 0; atomIx < atomsPer; atomIx++) {
00503     Atom *A = ps->atoms[atomIx];
00504     for(int probeIx = 0; probeIx < A->probes.size(); probeIx++) {
00505       Probe *p = A->probes[probeIx];
00506       if(Probe::isPm(*p)) {
00507         float intensity = cel->GetIntensity(p->id);
00508         Values.push_back(intensity);
00509         if (Min == -1 && Max == -1){
00510           Min = intensity;
00511           Max = intensity;
00512         }
00513         else{
00514           if (intensity > Max) Max = intensity;
00515           if (intensity < Min) Min = intensity;
00516         }
00517       }
00518     }
00519     
00520   }
00521   
00522   //}
00523   if(Values.empty()) 
00524     Err::errAbort("alleleMinMax() - Empty value vectors in probeset: " + ToStr(ps->name));
00525   //float median = median_in_place(Values.begin(), Values.end());
00526   
00527   return true;
00528 }
